data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Pointing your front-facing camera at the camera will allow you to see the whole picture. Pointing your back-facing camera at the camera will allow you to see the whole picture. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take 4 steps backward, you are not going back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You must turn around in order to return back to the starting point. The instructions say you take 6 + 4 = 10 steps. In order to turn around, you must take 4 = 8 steps. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Since all of the steps take 2 steps, and the first steps take 5 steps, the second step takes 7 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

Turning left has been done in two steps. Take 10 steps to turn left. Turn left again. Take 3 steps to turn right or return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You walk from one direction to another. Turn around. Take 7 steps each time. To turn around and get back to the beginning turn around again take 7 steps. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn right 4 times and turn right 3 times. In all 3 instances, you must return to the starting point exactly 1 mile (1.6 km) from the starting point. So, the answer is no.

To take 2 steps forward, you need to take 2 steps back. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The instructions require you to always "face forward" to move forward. If you can't face forward you'll always be facing back. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take 4 steps, you are back to the starting point. If you take 9 steps, you are back in the beginning. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
This is indecent and insipid to do. You can never do one step forward from facing forward. The first step was taken backwards. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always always face forward, you can go back as far as you want. The last step backward is what you do when facing forward. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you ever face a starting point then you facing forward is the starting point. And in order to return to the starting point you need to take all of the directions from the previous direction backward. This will make it look as though you are back at the starting point. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The instructions said you should always go toward the left. One cannot be facing right and left simultaneously. The answer: Yes.

All directions point to the same starting point. Always if you face forward, you always make sure you take 3 steps right every time you follow the instructions. There are only 5 ways that you can return to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

If you take 8 steps, you get to the beginning. Turn around is to go around and take 4 steps forward. If you turn around, you take 10 steps forward then turn back around to get to the starting point. Thus, the answer is Yes.

Take 9 steps to get back to the starting point. Take 7 steps to go back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you always face forward, you can never get back to where you began. So, the answer is No.

You can always face forward when you are away from the starting point. If you are facing the starting point, you cannot ever face backward. If you follow the instructions, you always face forward. If you always face left, you always take 6 steps left. It does not matter if you take 6 steps left or 6 steps right you always return back to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

It is the second part of a two part instructions. Just like the first part, if you turn right you turn around once and the other times are identical. So, the answer is Yes.

If you complete all 9 steps to turn around you will return at least 3 feet away from the starting point. If you complete all 9 steps to start you will come back at least 3 feet back in the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

For each of the 6 steps right, you take 1 step forward. In total, you take 4 steps right, 6 steps left, and 6 steps left. It takes 2 steps forward, 3 steps left, and 2 steps forward to return to the starting point. Thus, the answer is Yes.

Take 4 steps backwards at the same time as stepping forward. When you take 7 steps backwards, when you are stepping forward, you should always start with 1 foot forward. The initial step you should take is facing forward. In the first set of instructions, you only have to take 6 steps backwards and 10 steps forward. In the second set of instructions, you will only have to take 7 steps backwards, and 8 steps forward. After each set of instructions, you should always face forward. Thus, the answer is Yes.
